post.author: 김태희
post.content:
SAP Netweaver Mobile Architect
Skills:
SAP, Architect, IT, consulting, system, applications, Director, architecture, development, SAP ABAP, ABAP, Management
Date:
4-17-2010
Description:

Job Description SAP Netweaver Mobile Architect

SAP Netweaver Mobile Architect

Founded in 1976 in Montreal, CGI Group Inc. provides end-to-end IT and
business process consulting services to clients worldwide from our Centers
of Excellence throughout North America, Europe and India.

CGI one of the largest independent information technology and business
process services firms in the world, employing approximately 26,000
professionals in more than 100 offices globally. We have enjoyed over 30
years of sustained growth, during which time our team has built partnerships
with organizations that we are extremely proud of, and of whom we are
dedicated to serving with the utmost skill.

Are you ready to make a difference with a world-leader in Information
Technology consulting? If you want to experience the spirit of an
entrepreneurial organization, while enjoying the impressive resources of a
global company, we invite you to join us. We offer a challenging and
rewarding work environment. Theres always room for you to grow at CGIthats
our commitment to you.

POSITION SUMMARY

The GTA team of CGIs SAP Practice is responsible for providing our clients
value added SAP services within the local marketplace. We focus on new
implementations, enhancement projects, system upgrades, and advisory support
to our client base.

We currently have an exceptional career opportunity based in the Greater
Toronto Area for a SAP Netweaver Mobile Architect to assist with providing
mobile solutions to our clients ensuring their SAP applications are tightly
integrated with the Mobile Infrastructure (MI) to meet their daily business
needs. Advising and guiding our clients through your knowledge of SAPs
mobile offering and experience in architecting and configuration of the
solution.

Reporting to the Director of the GTA SAP Practice and working in a team
environment, you will be primarily accountable for the architecture, design
and configuration of SAP mobile solutions.
The principal functions of this position that will characterize your success
are:

Design and development of mobile infrastructure solutions for clients
Development of a mobile framework including standards and integration
architecture
Responding to clients needs within the scope of SAP mobile requirements

This unique role further allows you to utilize your full complement of
skills and experience by working with other consultants to build your
experience base, share and contribute to the success of the practice,
participate and provide input into estimation efforts and bids, and
contribute to developing collateral.

ESSENTIAL SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum 3 years experience in designing and implementing SAP mobile
solutions
Experience in configuration of the SAP mobile infrastructure (at least one
MI 7.0/7.1 implementation)
Experience in developing a mobile framework
Experience with mobile integration with MM and WM functionality
Experience in implementing connected and non-connected solutions
SAP ABAP including BAPIs
Strong coordination skills between functional and technical teams
Troubleshooting and resolving SAP functional issues
Ability to analyze problems and provide clear recommendations
Facilitation skills and ability to lead client meetings
Excellent written and verbal skills
Strong organizational skills
Understanding of new SAP mobile offerings

Additional consideration will be given to candidates who also possess the
following:
Experience in a consulting environment
Mobile Asset Management & Utilities (MAM/MAU)
Ability to identify value-added opportunities within mobile

If you have strong sense of drive, flexibility, willingness to build upon
your current skills and are looking for the kind of career youve always
wanted working with the GTA division of the SAP Practice, then we would be
very interested in speaking with you.

We offer the opportunity to work with Canadas largest information technology
outsourcing and management consulting company with a true global presence in
a fast-paced and energetic atmosphere where your own professional growth is
guaranteed your desire, commitment and impact.

The anticipated start date for this position is June 2010, so please
consider putting your resume together and apply online to CGI Careers.

Regrettably, we are unable to interview all applicants. We will contact the
best responses for an interview, so please make sure you tell us about what
you think we should know about you and how this position fits with your
career goals.

At CGI, were a team of builders. We call our employees members because all
who join CGI are building their own company one that has grown to 25,000
professionals in 100+ offices worldwide. Founded in 1976, CGI is a leading
IT and business process services firm committed to helping clients win and
grow. We have the global resources, expertise, stability and dedicated
professionals needed to achieve results for our clients and for our members.
Come grow with us. Learn more at www.cgi.com.

This is a great opportunity to join a winning team. CGI offers a competitive
compensation package with opportunities for growth and professional
development. Benefits for full-time, permanent members start on the first
day of employment and include a paid time-off program and profit
participation and stock purchase plans.

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying
for this position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be
contacted.
post.title: SAP Netweaver Mobile Architect
